intro: Oxytropis burhanbudaica, commonly known as Burhanbuda's locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Oxytropis burhanbudaica is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in its native habitat.
